p: To exert their functions, n-3 metabolites have been reported to inhibit NF-ÎºB (nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells), thus controlling several cytokines [ 43], and to bind the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor (PPAR) family of transcription factors more efficiently than n-6-derived metabolites [ 44]. Given their different and sometimes opposite effects, the importance of a strict controlled ratio between n-6 and n-3 accumulation and metabolism in the brain becomes clear.
